text: Koca Katran (literally "big cedar") is a monumental old prickly cedar (Juniperus oxycedrus) in Mersin Province, southern Turkey. It is a registered natural monument of the country. The tree is in Dümbelek Pass of Cocokdere Valley in Toros Mountains at an elevation of . Nearest settlements are Arslanköy town and Tırtar village of Toroslar district in Mersin Province. Its distance to Mersin city center is about . Entrance to the valley, where the tree is situated, is barred, and access is subject to permission from the forestry authority. The tree is high and the circumference of its trunk is at diameter. The nameplate at site states the age of the cedar as 625 years old. The old tree was registered a natural monument on September 27, 1994. ==References== Category:Individual trees in Turkey Category:Natural monuments of Turkey Category:Nature of Mersin Province Category:Toroslar District
title: Koca Katran (Mersin)
